tika.dc.description:
_The Shaman's Doorway_ is a significant and inspiring treatise on the importance of traditional indigenous values in modern psyche and society. Drawing on his own experience as a psychotherapist and his understanding of primordial shamanic traditions, Professor Stephen Larsen shows the relevance of shamanic practice to the modern world and how it can lead to a creative and affirmative relationship with life. Defining the task of the shaman as one of bringing meaning and healing into life, and creating a sense of accord with the root of all being, Larsen clearly shows how the shaman, all too often perceived as belonging to the past, actually holds the key to our future. 

SHAMANISM / INDIGENOUS TRADITIONS "Shamanism represents a body of knowledge that is pertinent to the ailments of contemporary society.
